Question: This person spoke at meetings of the Psycho-Medical Society in London in 1913 and 1914.
Hints: Thacher told Wilson about the Oxford Group, and through them Wilson became aware of Hazard's experience with this person.
This person became seriously ill on this trip and endured two weeks of delirium in a Calcutta hospital.
This person saw Freud's theory of the unconscious as incomplete and unnecessarily negative.
